001package org.relationlearn.util.io;
002
003import java.io.FileWriter;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.io.Writer;
006import java.util.ArrayDeque;
007import java.util.Map;
008import java.util.Map.Entry;
009import java.util.PriorityQueue;
010import java.util.Queue;
011import org.relationlearn.model.ArgumentNode;
012import org.relationlearn.model.ArgumentRelation;
013import org.relationlearn.model.RelationDigraph;
014import org.relationlearn.util.RelationType;
015
016/**
017 * OutputGenerator implementation which generates a group of files in the
018 * <a href="http://www.dbai.tuwien.ac.at/research/project/argumentation/systempage/docu.htm">
019 * ASPARTIX</a> AF extension language format, which can be used for argument 
020 * reasoning argumnet reasoning using tools such as 
021 * <a href="http://www.dlvsystem.com/">DLV</a>.
022 * 
023 * @see OutputGenerator
024 */
025public class DLVFileGenerator implements OutputGenerator {
026    
027    private final String VAF = "vaf.";
028    private final String ARG = "arg(";
029    private final String VAL = "val(";
030    private final String VPR = "valpref(";
031    private final String ATT = "att(";
032    
033    private final Queue<String> ARG_QUEUE;
034    private final Queue<String> VAL_QUEUE;
035    private final Queue<String> ATT_QUEUE;
036    private final PriorityQueue<Integer> WGHT_QUEUE;
037    
038    public DLVFileGenerator() {
039        this.ARG_QUEUE = new ArrayDeque<>();
040        this.VAL_QUEUE = new ArrayDeque<>();
041        this.ATT_QUEUE = new ArrayDeque<>();
042        this.WGHT_QUEUE = new PriorityQueue<>();
043    }
044    
045    /**
046     * Generates a group of .dl files taking as base path the
047     * parameter {@code basePath}.
048     * 
049     * <p>
050     * <b>Notes on basePath parameter:</b> Take for example the input path:<br/>
051     * {@code /home/output}</br/>Then if the parameter {@code graphTable} 
052     * contains a graph called {@code graph1} and another one called 
053     * {@code graph2} the results after the method call would generate two 
054     * files called:<br/> {@code /home/output_graph1.dl} and 
055     * {@code /home/output_graph2.dl} <br/> which would contain the 
056     * information found in each RelationDigraph object respectively.
057     * 
058     * @param graphTable the Map containing the data to be used in the
059     * output generation
060     * @param basePath the base path were the output files will be
061     * generated
062     */
063    @Override
064    public void generateOutput(Map<String, RelationDigraph> graphTable,
065            String basePath) {
066        for(Entry<String, RelationDigraph> de : graphTable.entrySet()) {
067            String file_path = basePath + "_" + de.getKey() + ".dl";
068            generateDLVFile(de.getValue(), file_path);
069        }
070    }
071    
072    private void generateDLVFile(RelationDigraph digraph, String filename) {
073        try (Writer writer = new FileWriter(filename, false)) {
074            writer.write(VAF + "\n");
075            gatherGraphData(digraph);
076            writeGraphData(writer);
077        } catch (IOException ex) {
078            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error in .dl generation: " + 
079                    ex.getMessage());
080        }
081    }
082    
083    private void gatherGraphData(RelationDigraph digraph) {
084        String nodeName, targetName;
085        Integer nodeWeight;
086        ArgumentRelation nodeRelation;
087        RelationType nodeRelType;
088        ArgumentNode targetNode;
089        for(ArgumentNode node : digraph) {
090            nodeName = "n" + node.getNodeId();
091            nodeWeight = node.getNodeWeight();
092            ARG_QUEUE.add(ARG + nodeName + ").");
093            VAL_QUEUE.add(VAL + nodeName + ", " + nodeWeight + ").");
094            if(!WGHT_QUEUE.contains(nodeWeight)) {
095                WGHT_QUEUE.add(nodeWeight);
096            }
097            if((nodeRelation = node.getTargetRelation()) != null) {
098                nodeRelType = nodeRelation.getArgumentRelationType();
099                if(RelationType.ATTACK.equals(nodeRelType)) {
100                    targetNode = nodeRelation.getTarget();
101                    targetName = "n" + targetNode.getNodeId();
102                    ATT_QUEUE.add(ATT + nodeName + ", " + targetName + ").");
103                }
104            }
105        }
106    }
107    
108    private void writeGraphData(Writer out) throws IOException {
109        Integer f1, f2, i;
110        while(ARG_QUEUE.size() > 0) {
111            out.write(ARG_QUEUE.poll() + "\n");
112        }
113        if(WGHT_QUEUE.size() > 1) { 
114            while(VAL_QUEUE.size() > 0) {
115                out.write(VAL_QUEUE.poll() + "\n");
116            }
117            while(WGHT_QUEUE.size() > 1) {
118                f1 = WGHT_QUEUE.poll();
119                f2 = WGHT_QUEUE.peek();
120                out.write(VPR + f2 + ", " + f1 + ")." + "\n");
121            }
122            WGHT_QUEUE.remove();
123        }
124        while(ATT_QUEUE.size() > 0) {
125            out.write(ATT_QUEUE.poll() + "\n");
126        }
127    }
128
129}
